description:
Description
a cross-section from 1983 to 1986
number of observations :  609
observation :  individuals
country :  United States
title: Level of Calculus Attained for Students Taking Advanced Micro–economics
reference: Butler, J.S.,  T. Aldrich   Finegan and  John J.  Siegfried (1998) “Does more calculus improve student learning in intermediate micro and macroeconomic theory ?”, Journal of Applied Econometrics, 13(2), April, 185–202.

parameters.mathcourse: number of courses in advanced math (0 to 3)
parameters.physiccourse: number of courses in physics (0 to 2)
parameters.mathlevel: highest level of math attained , an ordered factor with levels 170, 171a, 172, 171b, 172b, 221a, 221b
parameters.chemistcourse: number of courses in chemistry (0 to 2)
parameters.major:
one of other, eco, oss
(other social sciences), ns (natural 
sciences), hum (humanities)
